com.sri.ai.util.collect

Class NestedIterator<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.util.collect.EZIteratorWithNull<E>
      • com.sri.ai.util.collect.NestedIterator<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<E>

    @Beta
public class NestedIterator<E>
extends EZIteratorWithNull<E>
    An iterator that does not range over its elements, but over ranges of sub-iterators computed from its elements. By default, the sub-iterators of elements are:
    • the iterator over the collection if the element is a collection
    • the iterator itself if the element is an iterator,
    • the sub-iterator of an object O if the element is a NullaryFunction returning O (this can be used to create collections or iterators lazily, only when this point is reached), and
    • the iterator over the singleton composed by the element if it is neither a collection nor a iterator not a NullaryFunction.

    For example, NestedIterator(list.iterator()) will range over "a", "b", "c", ... if list is list("a", list("b", "c"), (NullaryFunction) () -> iterator("e", list("f", "g")), ...), where list and iterator are functions creating lists and iterators from a variable number of arguments.

    The method determineSubIterator(Object) can be overridden in order to customize the decision of when to recurse or not.

    Author:
    braz
